alert.note: Alert for Logan County; Morgan County; Northeast Weld County; Phillips County; Sedgwick County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 01 at 11:38AM MST until January 03 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...LONG DURATION WINTER STORM FOR MOUNTAINS...SNOW AND MIXED PRECIPITATION DEVELOPS OVER THE PLAINS THIS EVENING... .A storm system will move into the Desert Southwest today and then track to the Four Corners area late tonight. On Monday, it will move across Colorado and then push into the Central Plains by Monday night. This track will support development of widespread snow, as well as some light freezing precipitation across portions of the plains. In the mountains, ongoing heavy snow in the far northern tier of mountains will taper off late this morning. After a lull through the rest of he day, snow will redevelop this evening and continue through Monday and Monday evening before tapering off again late Monday night. Hazardous and slow travel conditions can be expected during this period. Across the foothills, I-25 Corridor, and adjacent plains, areas of snow will be developing this evening, with the most persistent snow spreading to the northern border area through early Monday morning. Behind that, areas of light freezing drizzle or rain will be possible, leading to icy road conditions. Precipitation will trend to almost all snow by mid to late afternoon Monday, and there may be an increase in snowfall rates as well especially on the northeastern plains into Monday evening. Travelers across the foothills and plains will encounter hazardous travel conditions starting this evening and continuing through Monday and Monday evening. ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation possible. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 6 inches, and ice accumulations around one tenth of an inch possible. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado. * WHEN...From late tonight through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on icy and hazardous road conditions.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
